message: With the Oval Tower destroyed, Platinum Jail ceased to function.
But thanks to prompt intervention from the mainland, the chaos was quickly resolved.
The tower collapsed because of terrorist bombs, coupled with a malfunction in Platinum Jail's central control system. Beyond that, details are scarce.
By some miracle, everyone in the tower managed to escape with, at worst, minor injuries.
Apparently, they all received a message alerting them before the building's collapse.
However, a number of people窶品ncluding Toue himself窶病re still missing.

The incident brought Toue's mind control research to light. The Celebration, which was a cover for his largest experiment yet, was canceled.

It might have put all of Midorijima under his control.

The Toue Corporation's products and services窶品ncluding Allmates窶婦ere transferred to other corporations.

Rhyme, too, changed hands. Usui was replaced.
And thus, bit by bit, the shadow of the Toue Corporation was lifted from my town.
Now, the people of Midorijima are working hard to return it to its former glory.
Mink's guys and I made it safely back to the Old Resident District.
At the gate to Platinum Jail, the members of Scratch who'd stayed behind came to meet us.
One of them walked up to me and asked if I was Aoba.
Apparently, he was the person Mink had been talking to that night, when he mentioned wanting to "turn someone over."
Mink had asked him to be there for me once it was done.
And yet, I doubted him... I felt so ashamed.
I just wanted to see him again. To apologize.
...But I couldn't. He was gone.
Mink had ordered Scratch to disband after this final mission, and told them they were free to do as they pleased.
But the gang wasn't remotely interested in disbanding.
If anything, they were more determined than ever to honor the memory of their boss.
Since I was the last person to see Mink, everyone asked me what had happened to him.
So I replied jokingly, "You really think anything could kill Mink?"
And they all responded, "No chance in hell!" and laughed.
Things changed for me, too, after we returned.
First off, those awful headaches went away completely.
He seemed to fade as well, that presence which would grow whenever I used Scrap.
I can tell he's still there inside me, but sleeping, deep in my heart.
I'd be lying if I said I had no worries at all, but despite everything, things have been shockingly calm since the incident.
...Time flies by, and Mink is still gone.

name: 蒼葉
message: "Yes."

name: 蒼葉
message: "...Yes. Yes. I understand. We'll take care of it. Thank you."

name: 蒼葉
message: "...Phew."
I put down the receiver and stretch a bit before resting my elbows on the counter.
I just got off the phone with a customer.
I used to get a lot of calls from weirdos who just wanted to hear my voice, but not so much anymore.
Ever since the tower was destroyed, life has pretty much returned to normal, even in the Old Residential District.
I'm still working at Hum-Drum Junk, and everyone else―Koujaku, Noiz, and Clear―is safe.
Mizuki is recovering too. I even went to visit him yesterday.

The way things are now, I can't help but wonder sometimes if all that craziness wasn't just a dream.

But no. I know it was real.

For one thing, plenty of other people remember what happened.

But more than that...
...Mink is gone.
I still don't know if Mink escaped the tower.
I've tried to track him down using what few resources I have, but I haven't even been able to confirm whether he's still alive.
I know it's not likely, not after that, but I just can't accept that there's no hope.
Maybe he's still alive somewhere. Part of me believes that.
...Part of me wants so badly to believe.
The members of Scratch were put on trial as escaped prisoners, but ultimately released on parole.
When the records were investigated by the island's new government, it turned out that most of them were in on extremely minor offenses.
I still meet with those guys on occasion, hoping they've heard something about Mink.
Now, maybe it's just me, but ever since the incident in Platinum Jail, I feel like the guys from Scratch have really changed.
I would never have met them if it hadn't been for Mink, but now we share a history.

name: ミンクチームＡ
message: "We're all from the prison in the north quarter. When prisoners get sent there, they convince 'em they'll die if they ever leave."

name: ミンクチームＡ
message: "They put you in this weird room with these lights and this music... Fucks with your head."

name: ミンクチームＡ
message: "So no one ever tries to escape. You can't, even if you want to. That's why you hear we're so well behaved for a buncha supposedly hardcore criminals."

name: ミンクチームＢ
message: "But Mink was the one who broke their hold on us. When we lost our shit, thinking we were gonna die, he beat some sense into us!"

name: ミンクチームＡ
message: "Man. First time he slugged me, I thought I really was gonna die."

name: ミンクチームＢ
message: "In rare cases, some people are strong enough to break the hypnosis. Mink was one of those people."

name: ミンクチームＢ
message: "Apparently, getting thrown in prison was all part of his plan to get to Toue. Crazy son of a bitch, huh?"

name: ミンクチームＡ
message: "Actually, I heard it was a direct order from Toue."

name: ミンクチームＡ
message: "One of the guards, he said they were supposed to keep an eye on him. Something to do with Toue's research. Like a test subject? Something like that."

name: ミンクチームＡ
message: "Those prisons were just dumping grounds anyway. Those assholes from Platinum Jail used 'em to hide their dirty laundry and shit."

name: ミンクチームＡ
message: "Mink was there for a good long time. He won over the guards and they pretty much let him do what he wanted."

name: ミンクチームＡ
message: "Slip 'em a little cash, they'd tell you whatever you asked. We pretty much had the run of the place, so earning wasn't hard, either."

name: ミンクチームＡ
message: "Man, I just wanna see him again, y'know? It'd take more than that to kill Mink. He's alive somewhere. You can bet on it."

name: 羽賀
message: "Aoba."
I'm staring at Junker, lost in thought, when Mr. Haga calls my name.

name: 羽賀
message: "You can take the rest of the day off."

name: 蒼葉
message: "But it's still a little early..."

name: 羽賀
message: "I don't think we'll be getting many more customers today. I should be able to manage on my own."

name: 蒼葉
message: "...Alright, thanks. I guess I'll head out, then."

name: 羽賀
message: "I'll see you tomorrow."
This isn't the first time he's let me off early. Although he never says anything outright, I can tell Mr. Haga is looking out for me.
My worries were probably showing on my face.
Mink... I feel bad about neglecting my work, but I just can't stop thinking about him.
He has to be alive. He has to.
That feeling grows stronger with each passing day.
I bow to Mr. Haga and pick up my bag.

name: 蒼葉
message: "Ren, we're going home."

name: 蓮
message: "Understood."
I pick up Ren and put him in my bag.
Somehow, I managed to repair him after we got back.
Mr. Haga helped source the parts, but I was determined to do the work myself, rather than send him back to the manufacturer.
I'd promised, after all.

name: 蒼葉
message: "I'm off."

name: 羽賀
message: "Take care."
